alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 10:53PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Mateo and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 445 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Cruz, Boulder Creek, Ben Lomond and Felton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
